title: A Third-Factor Account of Locality: Explaining Impenetrability and Intervention Effects with Minimal Search
excerpt: This paper unites two word order constraints under domain-general minimal search
citation: Seth Aycock. 2020 "A third-factor account of locality: explaining impenetrability and intervention effects with minimal search." Cambridge occasional papers in linguistics 12, no. 1 (2020): 1-30.

title: Detecting Trending Terms in Cybersecurity Forum Discussions
excerpt: We introduce a lightweight method to detect trending terms in cybersecurity forums.
citation: Jack Hughes, Seth Aycock, Andrew Caines, Paula Buttery, and Alice Hutchings. 2020. "Detecting Trending Terms in Cybersecurity Forum Discussions". In Proceedings of the Sixth Workshop on Noisy User-generated Text (W-NUT 2020), pages 107â€“115, Online. Association for Computational Linguistics.

title: Target-side CCG Supertag Prediction Improves Machine Translation
excerpt: Using a novel tag prediction step in decoding we improve NMT quality in a low-resource scenario.
citation: Seth Aycock. 2021. " Target-side CCG Supertag Prediction Improves Machine Translation". MSc Thesis. University of Edinburgh.
